result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael T Meseberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Sentence currently being served at Fox Lake Correctional as to Dane Co Case No. 2006CF001711.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $612.72 shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Court orders the costs in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any costs remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
No contact whatsoever with the victim, other than what is required during the performance of victim's duties at the correctional institution
Defendant to comply with any further terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 11:35 AM: Defendant Michael T Meseberg in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Resolution recited by ADA.  Def and counsel confirm joint agreement on resolution.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed.  INFO stated - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Meds/Treatment serving no impairment on proceeding today.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Court notes filing of Rest Summary previously filed.  Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  ADA makes statement to the Court on behalf of the prison.  Statement by SPD and questions final amount on Restitution.  ADA states that Rest figure may ultimately be decreased.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:  Will follow recommendation made today - appropriately addresses the severity of what happened.  S/W - 3 yrs probation - consecutive to any existing sentence or term of imprisonment - Conditions:  No contact whatsoever with the victim, other than what is required during the performance of his duties at the correctional institution (SPD states Def was transferred to Fox Lake); Rest of $612.72 and may be adjusted following determination of the WC lien that would be determined by the WC insurer for the victim, if there is a deductible would be paid to the State and what was paid by the insurer; any other terms as deemed appropriate; Court Costs plus DNA surcharge - 60 DTP or PP - up to 25% of earnings during term of incarceration authorized for application to costs; DNA sample if not already been supplied.  State to provide updated information as to medical portion of the claim by the1st of the year, any change to Rest amount should be accomplished via Stip and Order.  If necessary, Court will conduct further hearing.  Appeal Rights Given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:08 PM: Defendant Michael T Meseberg in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of 20 day time limits for preliminary hearing.   ADA argues as to $2500 Signature Bond w/no contact provisions.  SPD argues a to request for no contact provisions of bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 09:10 am.
